subtitle: [Music]
New Thinking Allowed. Conversations on the
leading edge of knowledge and discovery with
parapsychologist Jeffrey Mishlove. Hello and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. Today,
we are going to take a speculative look at ancient Atlantis. My guest is Dr. Angela
Thompson-Smith. She is a remote viewer who
trained with both Paul Smith and Lynn Buchanan,
both of whom have been interviewed on this
channel. She is a founding member and director
of the International Remote Viewing Association.
She is the author of Diary of an Abduction,
a scientist probes the enigma of her alien contact, Voices from the Cosmos co-authored
with C. B. Scott-Jones, Seer, 30 Years of Remote
Viewing, Tactical Remote Viewing, which is the
book upon which today's interview will be
based, but also remote perceptions, out-of-body
experiences remote viewing, and other normal
abilities. As I mentioned initially, this
is a speculative interview, but I could think of
no one better to engage in a highly speculative
interview focusing on remote viewing abilities
than Dr. Angela Thompson-Smith. Once again,
this is an internet interview. Now, I'll switch
over to the internet video. Welcome, Angela.
I'm very glad to be with you once again.
I'm very happy to be here again. We're going
to focus today on the work you did looking at ancient Atlantis. In some ways, this is
sort of a project I would regard it as parallel
to our previous discussion about looking at
alien entities who could communicate with you telepathically.
Fairly similarly, and it was tasked by the same client, what I found though with the
Atlantis project was that these were very real humans that I was interacting with.
I guess we're talking about retro-cognitions,
since in effect you're communicating with
beings who presumably were alive on the planet tens of thousands of years ago.
Yeah, right, yeah. Retro-cognition and
retro-telepathy, a lot of looking back at history.
Just as with the voices from the cosmos, there's
an element of speculation because it's very
difficult, almost impossible to get physical,
empirical confirmation of the information
that comes through.
Absolutely. As I said before with many of
my other projects, I approach them with some
skepticism, with some caution, and I try and
keep my own biases out of the picture and
understand that there's very little feedback
to be had. However, information that we can
get from the past can assist us now in the future.
My client was very interested in alternative
healing or alternative technology, so some
of the information that I was able to access
in this group of projects was very helpful to him.
I gather one of his interests was the question
of longevity, that presumably people in ancient
times lived longer.
Right, and looking after I had done the projects,
I amassed a large collection of literature,
and going back through some of that literature
was confirming in some aspects, some of it
didn't match at all, and most of it didn't match at all, but I was able to find some
confirmations on ages and dates and potential
dates because nobody really knows when, but
there was also some work from, I believe it
was Plato, that talked about the early Atlantis
times from their history.
Well, as a matter of fact, I did do an earlier
interview with Jason Reza Giorgiani looking
at philosophers who have written about ancient
Atlantis. They include Rudolf Steiner, Colin
Wilson, and of course Plato. So, I'm going to link to that interview for viewers who
are interested. There'll be a hot link right
now in the upper right-hand corner of your
screen.
But in addition to the philosophical writings
concerning Atlantis, there are also a history
of clairvoyance who have written about it,
and I suppose Rudolf Steiner, the philosopher,
fits into both categories.
There is a huge database, in fact. As I had
mentioned to you, I have put together an Excel
file of written resources that I'm willing to share.
And since you mentioned it, we'll link to that as well right now, once again, in the
upper right-hand corner of your screen. If you'd like to download the Excel file with
resources concerning ancient Atlantis, there
will be a hot link there for you, and it will
also be in the description that you can find
if you scroll down beneath the YouTube video
to the description. The hot link will be there as well.
That would be great. Thank you.
So concerning ancient Atlantis, you entered
into a state of consciousness where you felt
you could enter into telepathic communication with
someone who lived there to ask them questions.
It was a little bit of several different
methodologies. The main methodology I used was extended
remote viewing, which is an altered state, streaming access to information, as well as
OBE, out-of-body experience, because I had
out-of-body experiences since I was a child,
so I will use those or that ability from time
to time. So in this project, in the Atlantis,
well, there are a series of projects, I used
a more natural remote viewing rather than
the strict military-controlled remote viewing or coordinate remote viewing.
I am assuming that just like the project you
did communicating with alien intelligences,
there was a sense that you were really communicating
with someone, that this was not just imagery
from your subconscious imagination.
It really felt that way because the very first
project I was asked to contact three individuals
in Atlantis, first of all, just to sort of
ground myself in the project, in the experience,
and I found three individuals that I was able
to contact of different classes, because it
seems that Atlantis was comprised, it was a
very class society, ranging from the fishermen
to the sailors to the, right up to the elite,
and they lived on various aspects, and it
was a series of islands that I perceived rather
than the discrete rings that have been portrayed
by artists. So these were rings of islands
rather than joined together islands with bridges.
So the folks who were on the lower end of the scale, the fishermen and the farmers
were on the outer islands, and the elite lived
right in the center, and that's where I found
three individuals that I was able to have a,
it was a telepathic in a way if these were
individuals, because I can't prove that,
but there was definitely a contact with some
information from the past which showed itself to me as three distinct individuals.
As I recall, there was even a sense of personality
there, like one individual felt a little
impatient waiting to talk to you while you
were busy conversing with one of the others.
Right. That surprised me because I thought I was
talking to three individuals at discrete times,
unknown to the others, but that wasn't the case. That surprised me.
You started out with a woman who was engaged in farming.
Right. A very simple but very intelligent woman,
and she told me a little bit about the divisions.
I would have to talk to this other person if I needed more information, for example.
A very likeable, very likeable person and very down to earth.
I don't know. I suppose you could think back to the peasants of Europe, a very
homespun, very down to earth, very practical people, and she was too.
Then the second encounter was with a fisherman or some other worker?
He was more of a worker. He chastised me for talking with the woman
because it seems that they did not socialize with each other.
He was a little on the abrupt side. I was able
to glean quite a bit of information from him,
but it was more work talking to him than it was to the woman.
The third person you describe as an elder?
Yeah. There was a very high class of Atlanteans
who were the elders, the ones that lived for an
incredibly long life. They lived a very pampered
life. They didn't work. In fact, some of them were
even carried around because, well, one thing was
that they were very old and very disabled at the
end. This was a woman because women were the
matriarchs, and there were patriarchs too,
but the matriarch was basically a matriarchal
system. She talked to me, but in a friendly,
but almost a condescending manner. I wanted
to know who I was. It was interesting talking
to all three of them because there were
different aspects of society that came through.
As I recall, one of the points she made, that is, even though her body was so frail,
she had to be carried around everywhere, she
devoted herself to the cultivation of the mind.
Yes. Yeah. That sounds like a wonderful way to be. If you're going to live a long life,
get carried around and just meditate.
And in addition, you write about a conversation
actually with Plato himself about Atlantis.
At the very end, just for fun, I thought, okay, if I can contact these other folks,
let me see if I can contact Plato. He was actually deceased, but I was able to talk,
I imagine, to the spirit of Plato rather than him
when he was living. He was really not very happy
with me talking to him, but he gave me some information about what he had perceived.
And at the end, he was like, well, just leave
a tired old man to sleep. So he seemed a very
real character. I suppose another way of looking
at what you're doing, some people would say,
you're accessing the Akashic records, the records of everything that's ever happened.
That's a metaphor for all the information that
ever has been is and will be similar to what we
call the matrix in remote viewing, that there is
a repository of information that can be accessed
and through various methods. So that's true.
It could be said I was accessing the Akashic
record or the Akashic library. You know, some
people might look at this through a spiritualist
lens. Other people might suggest it's the Akashic
records or my friend Marty Rosenblatt would say,
the universe of collective consciousness. Yeah, it's called by many names.
Now, you mentioned that Atlantis, as you
experienced it in this process, had classes,
social classes that were quite distinct. You
also write that there were different historical
periods. It wasn't simply a uniform society
from age to age. It lasted for, I think, tens of
thousands of years and there were, you might say,
different epochs. Right. And I didn't, of course,
I didn't have the time or the resources to go into
every epoch. But I did go backwards and forwards.
For example, my client was very interested in
the rituals that were performed on Atlantis.
So at one point I went to a location where there was a temple where there were roaming
bulls, a bit like the Mistraic religions. And the
individuals who were there serving in the temple
were hunting the bulls and the bulls were hunting
them. So that was quite dramatic. And I'm very
much an animal lover. So that was not my choice.
It was where I ended up. I asked to see a ritual
and that's what I perceived. And you also wrote
about the technology that they had. There was
a primitive society, but they seemed to be able
to work with, I think, what you describe as Earth
energies. Absolutely. And that was fascinating
because I'd always heard about them using copper
and crystals, but I didn't understand that they
were used in combination. So they would drive
these large copper spikes way down into the Earth.
And they were also connected with crystals. And
they would draw up the energy from the Earth.
But they had to ground it. For example,
when rainwater came in, that could often disturb
the energy. And that had to be siphoned off and
back into the ocean because that could disable the
system. So even back then, there was technology
that they had to consider. One of the interesting
things that you wrote about also had to do with
the social class is that apparently the working
class lifespan was shorter because they worked
so hard. The elites seemed to have a very
prolonged lifespan. I think you suggest maybe
over 200 years. Right. Incredibly long lives. But
there again, we don't know how they divided up
their year or what they termed years. It could
have been that a month to them could have been
a year or six months could have been a year in their vocabulary. That I wasn't able to
ascertain. But they did seem to be able to live for an incredibly long life.
You also described that they had ships. They were
navigating the oceans. They visited other lands.
They engaged in trade. What they did was they
had a keel on the ship that was made of copper.
And this also was able to gather in some of the
energy from the salt water. Because the energy was
when the rainwater was siphoned back into the
ocean, that, of course, took it back in for,
I suppose, a regeneration. And the mariners
utilized that energy. And they did have some sales
for when they needed press to be near the shore
or in freshwater. But when they were in the sea,
they did use these keels and used the energy from the keels to direct the ships.
There are some myths about Atlantis that suggest
that they were a highly advanced technological
civilization that destroyed themselves. I gather your readings didn't confirm that.
Well, yes and no in terms of the technology. They were, apart from the
apart from the elite at the top, they lived
very simple lives and very contemplative lives.
And I didn't remote view when it was destroyed.
I did go to locations where the Atlanteans
could possibly have landed when they took off
in their ships, because that was the information
that I perceived. And it seems after doing I did some research after the fact of the
west coast of Europe. So in terms of Scotland,
Wales, Ireland, all around the perinean area of
the continent, there are some very, very interesting
and unusual people and languages and customs.
And they are right in a direct line with what
would have been a migration coming in from the sea
along that long coast. So it's quite possible that
the Atlanteans landed on the west coast of Europe,
and perhaps even further south, we don't know.
But for example, you know, the Welsh language
is very, very different from any other language
in Europe. The Scots for the Gallic is different,
but they all have some similarities. While they're
different in themselves, there are similarities
between them, where they're very different from the other European languages. So
there's also a period of time, and I think it was
about 30,000 years ago, where I forget the actual
dates, where under the blue, there appeared this
civilization in Europe. Nobody knew where it came
from. They came in with weapons, with energies, with language, with art, crafts,
that nobody had ever seen before. And when they
do the archaeological research, there is nothing
preceding this people that could account for them.
So it's quite possible that they came in from
Atlantis. I think you're referring to what is known
as, I believe it's called Aurignacian culture.
Right, yes, yes. So there's quite a bit of archaeology, for example, the various cave
paintings in Europe, some of which are quite
sophisticated, seem to be attributed to the
Aurignacian culture. Absolutely. There's some
wonderful sculpture, and of course the cave
paintings. And what I found, I did a National
Geographic DNA search, which was from the maternal
line. And I've done other ones since, well, my
general DNA through Ancestry. I'm not advertising
here, this is just what I did. And so with the
National Geographic maternal line, I found that
I was haplogroup H, which had its roots way back
in the Aurignacian times, which really surprised
me and delighted me, actually, because my own
heritage came from way back through the maternal
line. And I gather that another word for the
Aurignacian culture is also the Cro-Magnon culture.
I think so. I'm not too sure, yeah. Did you hypothesize where Atlantis was? I mean, for
example, one of my other guests, Jason Giorgiani,
speculates that it's actually buried under the
ice cap in Antarctica. I've heard lots of stories
about it. It was at the Canary Islands, it was
north of the UK in the Docker Bank. It was in
the middle of the Atlantic. So I didn't do that,
that wasn't part of, I was guided very much by
the client's tasking. And that was one of the
taskings that he gave me to actually look at where
it might be. You know, some of the myths suggest
they developed all sorts of technological powers
and they destroyed themselves with their own
technology as if it's a warning to us of what we
might do. And I presume that's not what you found.
The main thing I found was that they had a climate change and they were getting
more rain than normal. I didn't actually look
at the cataclysm, but this was preceding.
So there was a lot of rainwater coming in and
both diffusing and making the energy that was
coming out from the Earth unstable. They weren't
able to drain off enough of the rainwater.
I think I speculated at the time that that could
have contributed to the demise. But there was a
lot of consternation at the time about this
situation. Did you ever develop a sense about
their religious practices? From what I saw of the
the bulls being used very much in ceremony, in
ritual, both in reality as the animal itself and
also as statues, that this was very much of a
Mithraic religion. They were also very contemplative
and one of the taskings that the client gave me
towards the end of our series was he was thinking
of putting together a spa or a retreat site
somewhere where he could bring in some of the Atlantis methodologies, practices, etc.
So what he asked me to do was to go to one of the
Atlantis centers where they went for rejuvenation
and for rest and relaxation. And it was fascinating
to describe. They did very much. It was not
technology as we know it, but they used the copper
implanted into the Earth in all of the beds,
the seating. The pool was a copper lined seawater
pond. Everything that they used to sit or eat or
talk was dug down into the Earth through copper
bronze and crystal rods. And they also had
a silence that was a bit like a monastic order.
As they came in, they gave in all of their
belongings and their payment and everything else
outside. When they went inside, they didn't speak.
They were fed a nutritious food, but they didn't
speak to anybody else except in quiet conversations
where they could go into secluded rooms, also into
dream rooms where they could dream and talk to
a person about their dreams. But there was no
chatter. There was no, if you go to a spa today
or a retreat site, there's a lot of chatter going
on. And that can be very distracting. But in this
spa, which was mostly outdoors, of course, it
was warm, a warm temperature that they could
very much just be for a period of time. And they
didn't go, say, for a day or a week or a month.
They went for as long as they needed. And
they told people that they were going to this,
this is what I perceived, that they were going
to the center where they could go in and leave
whenever they needed. But it was assumed that they would be there for a duration.
Many people suggest that the pyramids of Egypt and
perhaps pyramids elsewhere really originated with
the Atlantean culture. There are some Egyptologists
who wonder how the Egyptian culture seemed to
emerge so suddenly. Now, I know you've also done
readings on ancient Egypt. You've looked at the
Sphinx in particular. But from what I gather,
you didn't see an Atlantean connection there.
No. No. And I don't recall seeing pyramids on
the Atlantis that I perceived. It was not flat,
but they were not huge buildings such as the
pyramids. So, I think that was a completely
separate civilization. How would you compare the
results of your remote viewing with, let's say,
the reports of Edgar Cayce, who is well known
for having provided ostensible information about
Atlantis? I did look at a bit of that after
the fact because I didn't want to color my own
perceptions beforehand. But afterwards I went
and looked. And I did find some overlap, but his
viewings were more related to illness and disease
and how they were treated and from the readings
that I had. Go ahead. Well, I know I was just
going to thank you for being with me once again,
Angela. It's been a great pleasure. You're
welcome and I'm happy to come and talk about
much of the research that I've done and the
explorations, and there will be more to come.
And for those of you watching, thank you for being with us.
[Music]
